text.tspan: Graph From Text
To extract graph from an input text, do the following
(fig8):
Insert the bolt connection URI from Neo4J (the default
one should be already inserted
“bolt://localhost/7687”)
Insert the user of the database (the default user
should already be inserted “neo4j”)
Insert the database’s password (the one selected during
the neo4j setup)
Specify the location of the file to be analyzed. This
field already contains the base folder for
the provided examples; to select a file, just type
the name after the base folder (e.g. “bg.txt”
-> “./source_files/bg.txt”). If the user wants to
use other input files than the ones provided,
just type the absolute path of the file.
Select “yes” if you want to generate a prolog file,
with the extracted facts, from the neo4j
database. You must specify a file name (step 6).
Type the name of the output prolog file if you have
selected “yes” in the previous step. The
specified name will not need an extension or a path,
the file will be saved in the folder
“./prolog_files” (e.g. type the name “prova” -> the
file will be available in “TeKno - De
Laurentiis-Minervini/prolog_files/prova.pl”).
Select “yes” if you want to reset the graph. If the
user deactivated this option, the graph
extracted from the text will be built on top of the
already present instance, if exists.
Select “yes” if you want to allow the program to expand
the search using Wikipedia. This will
incorporate Wikipedia extracts from entities found
in the original text. This option can take a
long time to execute.
When all the previous inputs have been specified,
the user can click the “Submit” button to
launch the execution.
This text box will contain outputs from the current
execution.
